Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some things that were too weird that haunted you about the whole story line that wasn't really needed in the movie. My friend hated it because she thought it was cheesy, and over produced - but I say Sometimes cutz should be cheesy.
I definitely recommend this to your worst enemy

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. Nothing like a traumatic stress from an unreal incident to clear your mind off all hatred, resentment, pretence and contempt. It is not what I expected. Hate can be erased but prudence will always play a part of the game with love found lost.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat prowling the neighborhood.
Hate seeing something awful happen to an innocent animal. Hate has just described what you will see in this movie.
